primitive_variable_conversion Module Reference
transport

Module containing routines for converting mass to concentraion, and concentration to mass. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

pure subroutine cons2prim (conc, mass, area, nloc, nvar)
 Convert conservative variables (ie mass) to primitive (concentration) There is no precaution against divide by zero, so if you put in zero for area you will get NaN.
pure subroutine prim2cons (mass, conc, area, nloc, nvar)
 Convert primitive (concentration) to conservative variables (ie mass)
pure subroutine prim_increment_to_cons (mass, conc, area, nloc, nvar, scale)
 Increment a conservative variable using an increment (e.g. source) in primitive terms Converts increment of primitive (concentration) to conservative variable (mass) and adds it to the conservative variable. "Scale" will typically involve dt or half*dt.

Detailed Description

Module containing routines for converting mass to concentraion, and concentration to mass.

Member Function/Subroutine Documentation

pure subroutine primitive_variable_conversion::cons2prim ( real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(out)  conc,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(in)  mass,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc), intent(in)  area,
integer, intent(in)  nloc,
integer, intent(in)  nvar 
)

Convert conservative variables (ie mass) to primitive (concentration) There is no precaution against divide by zero, so if you put in zero for area you will get NaN.

Parameters:
[out]concConcentration (converted from mass per unit length )
[in]massMass per unit length
[in]areaArea at conversion locations
[in]nlocNumber of cells or faces
[in]nvarNumber of variables
pure subroutine primitive_variable_conversion::prim2cons ( real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(out)  mass,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(in)  conc,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc), intent(in)  area,
integer, intent(in)  nloc,
integer, intent(in)  nvar 
)

Convert primitive (concentration) to conservative variables (ie mass)

Parameters:
[out]massMass per unit length (converted from concentration)
[in]concConcentrations to convert
[in]areaArea at conversion locations
[in]nlocNumber of cells or faces
[in]nvarNumber of variables
pure subroutine primitive_variable_conversion::prim_increment_to_cons ( real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(inout)  mass,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc,nvar), intent(in)  conc,
real(stm_real), dimension(nloc), intent(in)  area,
integer, intent(in)  nloc,
integer, intent(in)  nvar,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  scale 
)

Increment a conservative variable using an increment (e.g. source) in primitive terms Converts increment of primitive (concentration) to conservative variable (mass) and adds it to the conservative variable. "Scale" will typically involve dt or half*dt.

Parameters:
[in,out]massMass per unit length (converted from concentration)
[in]concConcentrations to convert
[in]areaArea at conversion locations
[in]scaleScale factor
[in]nlocNumber of cells or faces
[in]nvarNumber of variables
